subject: Sales
title: Why Great Sellers Listen More Than Talk
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Great Sellers Listen More Than Talk.

hook.text: A study tracked top salespeople. They spoke only 46% of the time. Average sellers talked over 70%.

buildup.text: The best sellers let buyers do most of the talking. Every word a buyer shares is valuable data.

discovery.text: Listening reveals pain points, priorities, and objections before they surface. Information is leverage.

twist.text: Most sales training teaches talking: pitches, scripts, and rebuttals. Listening gets almost no airtime.

climax.text: Next time you sell, try this: let the buyer talk for two-thirds of the meeting. Watch what happens.

punchline.text: The best sellers talk less and close more.

quiz.question: How much of the conversation do top sellers typically control?
